ext_descriptions.ext_description: The product_or_formation_or_definition type allows for the designation of a , a , or a .

A document is an identification of a collection of information.
The information collected need not be represented in a format conforming to any EXPRESS schema.
JPEG and HTML files are examples of document.
This part of ISO 10303 provides several resources to describe documents and to associate them with product data. Annex F.2 provides an explanation about how to describe documents if they are to be considered products.

ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the
by which the document is known.
ext_description.note: The name may include the source of the document.
ext_description.example: An example of the source of a document is "ISO".

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
that characterizes the document. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

the
that specifies the sort of data that the document describes.

the set of
entities that specifies the way a document is represented.

A document_product_association is an association between a
and a , between a
and a , or between a
and a .
The role of document_product_association can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
The document_product_association may establish an equivalence between the
and the
or between the
and the
of the
and the . This equivalence will provide a document with the versioning structure found in the product_definition_schema.

the
by which the document_product_association is known.

the
that characterizes the document_product_association. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
the instance of
that is part of the association.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the instance of , , or
entity data type associated with an instance of .
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A document_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides a description of their relationship.
The role of document_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

the
by which the document_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the document_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A document_representation_type is a specification of the way a
is represented.

ext_description.p:
the
by which the document_representation_type is known.
ext_description.example: 'Digital' and 'physical' are examples for the name.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
for which the kinds of representation are specified.

A document_type is the kind of data that a formal standard or document may provide information about.
The applicable values of document_type can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
'Material', 'surface finish', and 'heat treatment process' are all pieces of data that can be described implicitly, by reference to other documents (such as standards documents), rather than explicitly every time they are used.

ext_description.p: the name of the kind of data contained in a document.
ext_description.example: 'Material description' is an example of product_data_type that characterizes the information provided by a standards document for material.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A document_usage_constraint is an identification of a specific subject area or aspect from within a document and gives the relevant information or text that applies. The semantics of the reference can be found in the
itself.
This entity could be used to identify the clause of a document and the content or portions of the content in that clause that are relevant.

ext_description.p:
the
in which the subject_element originates.
ext_description.note: The inverse of this relationship is used to define multiple elements of a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the name of an element of the source.

ext_description.p:
the
that conveys a specific value of the subject_element present in the source
ext_description.example: For references to a 'surface finish' source the subject_element may be a 'Clause 2.1 surface imperfection' and its associated subject_element_value may be 'no visible imperfections', 'no more than two imperfections that are more than 0.06 inch diameter within any given square inch of surface area', or 'no imperfections under 10 times magnification'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A document_with_class is a type of
for which a classification is specified.
A surface finish document may be identified by various classes, class A, class B, and class C. Each class of surface finish specifies various allowances for imperfections in the surface finish. Class A may require no visible imperfections, class B may require no more than two imperfections that are more than 0.06 inch diameter within any given square inch of surface area, and class C may require no imperfections under 10 times magnification.

ext_description.p:
the identification of the data classification to which the
belongs.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
ext_description.example: The value of this attribute would be 'A', 'B' or 'C' in the previous example.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The acyclic_document_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either a
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
for which the function is searching in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.
